title_sort: walt whitman to john h. johnston, 6 november 1881
title: Walt Whitman to John H. Johnston, 6 November 1881
text: 431 Stevens StreetCamden New JerseyNov: 6 '81—Evn'gEveningDear friendI made a good smooth fast trip back to Camden that afternoon—find every thing here moving on about the same—life here is pretty monotonous any time, & especially after banging about & seeing so many folks & being made so much of as I for the last three or four months—but I feel pretty well & find myself enjoying most things & times—this beautiful day among the rest—(now toward sundown, & I am writing this alone up in my room, 3d story—have had a nice quiet day)—The valise came all right—Thought it best to write to Leibkeucher, Newark, to ask whether I should send him the two vol. $10 edition, or the one vol. $2 one—which I have accordingly done—How are you Alma? How are you Ally boy?Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to John H. Johnston, 6 November 1881
